alert.note: Alert for Lincoln (Missouri) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Saint Louis (Eastern Missouri and West Central Illinois)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 21 at 5:21AM CDT until April 23 at 3:51AM CDT by NWS Saint Louis
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in St Louis MO has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Missouri... Cuivre River near Troy. River forecasts are based on observed precipitation and forecast precipitation for the next 24 hours. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM EARLY THIS MORNING TO EARLY SATURDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Cuivre River near Troy. * WHEN...From early this morning to early Saturday morning. * IMPACTS...At 23.0 feet, Considerable agricultural land is flooded between Troy and Moscow Mills. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 5:00 AM CDT Thursday the stage was 21.3 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 5:00 AM CDT Thursday was 21.3 feet. - Forecast...The river will fall below flood stage this morning to 20.6 feet and then begin rising this morning. It will then rise above flood stage late this morning to 21.9 feet this evening. It will fall below flood stage again late this evening. - Flood stage is 21.0 feet. && Fld Observed Forecasts (7 am CDT) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Fri Sat Sun Mon Tue Cuivre River Troy 21.0 21.3 Thu 5 am 17.5 10.6 8.7 8.2 7.9 &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Rainfall heavier than forecast could cause river levels to rise even higher than predicted. The National Weather Service will monitor this developing situation and issue follow up statements as conditions change. This product, along with additional weather and stream information, is available at https://water.weather.gov/ahps2/index.php?wfo=lsx.
